title_sort: walt whitman to hannah whitman heyde, 11 march 1891
title: Walt Whitman to Hannah Whitman Heyde, 11 March 1891
text: CamdenMarch 11 '91Sunny & fine to-day—had a letter f'mfrom Jess, St. Louis, this mn'gmorning — She is well & seems to be getting along—is ab'tabout 5 now, & I have eaten my early supper—had a fine varied meal bro'tbrought to me, but selected only some stew'dstewed tomatoes (with onions & crust bread) and half cup coffee, & sent the rest back—am sitting here same as usual—hope & pray it is comfortable with you, sister dear—a poor English street-singing boy stops out in the street & sings "the flowers that bloom in the spring" while another boy (his brother I fancy) fiddles. $2 enclosed—God bless you Han—Walt Whitman Walt Whitman to Hannah Whitman Heyde, 11 March 1891
